p: Regarding the essential oilexclusive compounds present in significant relative amounts in the analyzed plant parts, the bark is characterized by Î±-humulene which displays antitumoral [ 24], anti-inflammatory [ 25] and analgesic [ 26] effects, as well as the inhibiting capacity of CYP3A4, one of the main enzymatic complexes involved in the hepatic metabolism of drugs [ 27]. Safrole, exclusive of the essential oil from the immature fruits and present in high amounts, was already detected by Shanshan et al. [ 3] and Jiang et al. [ 18] and is currently recognized as a carcinogenic agent [ 28]. This compound is generically considered to be a typical component of the brown camphor oil from bark, not detected herein, and was widely used in the therapeutic field.
